techmeme.title: Since Xi Jinping met DeepSeek founder Liang Wenfeng last month, Chinese officials are rushing to use the AI model, including in courthouses and in hospitals (New York Times)
Germany's Federal Court of Justice rules against Apple's appeal against a regulatory assessment that opens Apple up to stricter controls in the country (Reuters)
A former CHIPS Act program officer says Trump repealing the program risks US national security and tariffs alone will not revitalize domestic chip manufacturing (Mike Schmidt/Financial Times)
Chicago-based Nerdio, which helps manage remote workers, raised $500M led by General Atlantic at a $1.2B valuation, sources say up from $300M in December 2022 (Gillian Tan/Bloomberg)
Didi reports Q4 revenue up 7.1% YoY to ~$7.32B and a ~$180M net loss, down from a ~$6.2M profit in Q4 2023, as it recovers from China's $1.2B fine in July 2022 (Reuters)
